thread.title: Ranking the Most Heartbreaking Moments of ‘This Is Us’ Season 1
thread.title_full: Ranking the Most Heartbreaking Moments of ‘This Is Us’ Season 1

author: Ariana Romero
title: Ranking the Most Heartbreaking Moments of ‘This Is Us’ Season 1
text:
Jan 11, 2017 at 10:16am PST Toby is actually alive Advertisement 
This was the first time Us decided not to leave us sobbing in our living rooms. It’s true: nothing bad can happen on Christmas Eve. Kevin has his ‘Manny’ meltdown Dec 6, 2016 at 12:34pm PST Kevin has his ‘Manny’ meltdown Advertisement 
Kevin Pearson’s on-set freakout wasn’t sad at all. We do wish we would have agreed to do the scene without his shirt on, though#KiddingNotKidding. Randall’s dad William is bisexual Jan 10, 2017 at 1:42pm PST Randall’s dad William is bisexual Advertisement 
William’s casual coming out was quietly revolutionary, giving viewers an elderly man of color who embraces the “fluidity” of sexuality without question. We’ll call that a win. Toby takes Kate to perform at the nursing home Oct 17, 2016 at 1:59pm PDT Toby takes Kate to perform at the nursing home Advertisement 
After years of standing in her hot celebrity brother’s shadow, nothing was more moving than seeing Kate in the spotlight for once. If we cried, they were all happy tears. Kevin refuses to throw Kyle a bone throughout their relationship Oct 24, 2016 at 6:30pm PDT Kevin refuses to throw Kyle a bone throughout their relationship Advertisement 
This was rough. On another show, Kevin’s constant shunning of his adopted brother would top the list. But with This Is Us , the tear-jerking moments are just getting started. Randall talks his co-worker out of suicide A night not to be missed! Join us as we celebrate the holidays with friends and family. Also, introducing Mr. @jimmisimpson ! #ThisIsUs pic.twitter.com/5NHQoovkqF — Sterling K Brown (@sterlingkb1) December 6, 2016 Randall talks his co-worker out of suicide Advertisement 
Hey, William from Westworld . Boy, do we wish you were here under happier circumstances. The moment Randall starts asking suicidal Andy about his daughter Chloe, it’s impossible not to tear up. Toby seemingly goes into cardiac arrest on Christmas Eve Dec 15, 2016 at 2:04pm PST Toby seemingly goes into cardiac arrest on Christmas Eve Advertisement 
The Us writers decided to be considerate and leave all this possible heartache looming for over a month. At least we know the story has a (mostly) happy ending, ignoring Toby’s arrhythmia. William reveals what dying feels like Dec 9, 2016 at 5:36pm PST William reveals what dying feels like Advertisement 
Somehow, this heartbreaking conversation wasn’t the saddest part of Pearson Family Thanksgiving 2016. Rebecca has a pregnancy breakdown over the Pearson’s money woes Jan 10, 2017 at 7:30am PST Rebecca has a pregnancy breakdown over the Pearson’s money woes Advertisement 
Poor Rebecca. Anyone would have a meltdown over possibly moving back in with Becca’s awful mother. At least Jack stepped up and supported his growing family, much to his own emotional trauma. Randall keeps a tally of all the black people he meets Nov 28, 2016 at 8:45pm PST Randall keeps a tally of all the black people he meets Advertisement 
The list was alarmingly low. Jack tells Randall “To me you’re every part my son” Nov 17, 2016 at 9:48am PST Jack tells Randall “To me you’re every part my son” Advertisement
